definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: He boasted that he was the best swimmer in the city.
sentences.chinese: 他夸口说他是本市最优秀的游泳者。

sentences.english: He boasts that he is an authority.
He prides himself on remembering the name of every man in the regiment.
sentences.chinese: 他爱夸口说全团的士兵他没有一个不知道姓名的。

sentences.english: Rom. 2:23 You who boast in the law, do you by transgression of the law dishonor God?
sentences.chinese: 罗二23你指著律法夸口，自己却犯律法玷辱神么？

sentences.english: I have therefore glory in Christ Jesus towards God.
sentences.chinese: 所以对于事奉天主的事，我可以在耶稣基督内夸口。

sentences.english: She is hasl dressed up nowhere to go.
sentences.chinese: 她服装得整一律却无处夸口。

sentences.english: His boastful throat soon grew hoarse with thirst, and he betook himself to prayer.
sentences.chinese: 不久，那夸口的喉咙因干渴而沙哑，他开始祈求。

sentences.english: The lotus offers its beauty to the heaven, the grass its service to the earth.
sentences.chinese: 菡萏向长天夸口它的娇美，小草则缄默地侍奉土地。

sentences.english: It has never been her boast that she alone could accomplish the work.
sentences.chinese: 她从没有夸口说只有她能完成那项工作。

sentences.english: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;
sentences.chinese: 所以无论谁，都不可拿人夸口，因为万有全是你们的。

sentences.english: Behold, thou art called a Jew, and restest in the law, and makest thy boast of God
sentences.chinese: 你称为犹太人，又倚靠律法，且指着神夸口。

sentences.english: Smoke boasts to the sky, and Ashes to the earth, that they are brothers to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 烟雾向天空，灰烬向大地夸口，都说它们是火的兄弟。

sentences.english: She bragged that she could run faster than I.
sentences.chinese: 她夸口说她比我跑得快。

sentences.english: No one likes him because he brags about how rich his family is.
sentences.chinese: 没有人喜欢他，因为他老是夸口他家多有钱。

sentences.english: John could horse-back ride with the best of them, but he never boasted about it.
sentences.chinese: 约翰的马术不下于任何人，但他从不夸口。

sentences.english: Ross went on, somewhat boastfully , to explain just how real estate profits were made.
sentences.chinese: 洛斯于是略带夸口的语气说明地产的生意应该怎么做。

definition: see 誇海口|夸海口[kua1 hai3 kou3]
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to make a false and unwarranted declaration
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
